summary: The Jobs in the Woods Act (H.R. 4575) aims to address forestry workforce development needs. It directs the Secretary of Agriculture to establish a competitive grant program for eligible entities to carry out career pathway training programs in forestry operations and products industries. Grants, ranging from $500,000 to $2,000,000, are authorized for up to four years, with priority given to programs addressing workforce aging and youth engagement. The bill also defines key terms and authorizes $10 million in appropriations annually from 2026-2030.
